edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj.UserInterface
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsoleInterface, GraphicInterface

    public abstract class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the interface facilitating communication between the user and the game. This class is abstract because there will be different interfaces for the console and GUI versions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Engine engine
      The Engine that this userInterface should query for gameState.
      protected boolean hasLooked
      Represents whetehr player looked on current turn or not
      protected boolean isDebugging
      This field represents whether debug mode is on or not.

      This method is the main loop in the game that represents each turn.

      This method shows the options menu where players can change the setting of the game.

      This method handles the user quitting the game, and essentially just terminates the program.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method starts the game and is called from the Main method. It creates the engine, something that should be done the same in all subclasses. Subclasses should call Super() before implementing their methods.

      • startGame

        public void startGame(java.io.File save)
        This method starts the game and is called from the Main method. It creates the engine, something that should be done the same in all subclasses. Subclasses should call Super() before implementing their methods. Positions of objects in the saved file is loaded into the engine.
        Parameters:
        save - of the saved game

      • openOptions

        public void openOptions()
        This method shows the options menu where players can change the setting of the game.

      • quitGame

        public void quitGame()
        This method handles the user quitting the game, and essentially just terminates the program.

      • testGetGrid

        public Grid testGetGrid()
        A debugging method that should only be used when the game is being tested.
        Returns:
        the grid being used
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if you try to use this when the game is not in debugging mode.
